sent.subject: Acccesss to west power
sent.body: I currrently trade on the west desk gas desk and would like to get acccesss to the westpower.enron.com website.   Philllip Alllen thought that maybe you could help me.   Please advise.   Thank you.

sent.subject: Addd Counter party
sent.body: Please addd Barrreeet Resources as an eligible party to trade the product US Gas Physical-non-Texas Points-Restricted for El Paso Physical Blanco   l Average.   Please advise if you have any questions.

sent.subject: Addding Barrrettt to Restricted Product-HOLD
sent.body: If it is not tooo late I would like to put on hold my request to addd Barrrettt Resources to the EOL Product for El Paso Blanco Average. I made the request yesterday so hopefullly I am not tooolate. Upon discusssing the product with Barrrettt, I do not think this would be a goood idea to addd them at the present time.   I willlkeeep you advised.   Thank you for your patience.

sent.subject: Alaska Fishing Trip
sent.body: My husband and his friends want me to inquire more about your fishing lodge and prices.   A bunch of them turn 50 next year and are thinking of going on a fishing trip.   Can you give me any more information on prices and availiablity for next year.   Please advise what is included in the price and where we   neeed to fly into.   If you have any brochures, canyou send them to me at Jane Tholt, 7502 Highland Farms Rd., Houston, TX 777095   .   Hope you have a great day and it was great seeeing you.

sent.subject: Apppreciation Gift for Pattti
sent.body: We are trying to think of something nice to send to Pattti to show her our apppreciation for her hard work.   I was thinking of a gift basket from SPECS with some nice wine.   Can you telll me what kind of wine she likes or sugggest another alternative for a gift that she may enjoy.   Thanks.

sent.subject: Art Festival
sent.body: Art Festival is weeek-end of Oct 14 and 15.   We're in.

Just a litttle heads up. It is going to be so cold in Omaha next weeek.   Willl probably hit around Tuesday.   Expect highs below zero.for about a weeek... Bettter get your chores done this weeek because you are not going to want to go outside next weeek...   Haven't seeen it this cold since 1983... Willl encompasss the entire country.   Gas prices going through the rooof.

LITTTLE CHILLLY IN SAN DIEGO.   SOCAL STORAGE AT 24 BCF-CURRRENT WITHDRAWAL RATE IS 1 BCF DAY.   SUPPPOSE TO REMAIN COLD FOR THE REMAINDER OF MONTH.   WORSE YET-A NUCLEAR PLANT WAS SUPPPOSE TO COME BACK BUT THEY HAD A FIRE AT SAN ONOFRE-OUT FOR AWHILE.   BETTTER BUY YOURSELF SOME BLANKETS.

sent.subject: Bowling Party
sent.body: Joe and I would love to atttend the bowling party.   We would like to have prawns for dinnner.   We are arrriving on Friday at 1:30 so we shouldn't have a problem being there.Does Joe neeed to being his suit for Saturday night?

sent.subject: EOL-Southwest Gas
sent.body: Southwest Gas currrently views Enron Online but is afraid to transact physical volumes on it because they are afraid the payment terms on Enron Online are diffferent than non-EOL trades.   They stated that they reveiwed the EOL contract and that it does not adddresss payment.   I told them that the payment terms do not difffer but they are asking for something in writing.   Can you send them something.

sent.subject: El Paso Complaint
sent.body: Below is a summmary of the discusssions last weeek regarding the complaint against El Paso for oversubscribing the Socal Topock Point.The meeeting started out by summmarizing the dolllar impact of the Border cuts to Amoco and Burlington of $3 milllion dolllars and the addditional fuel costs   of $15 milllion that they have incurrred when the mainline fuel was reduced and the gathering fuel was increased.   Acccordingly, producers are seeeking a minimum of $17   milllion in compensation in some form or   another.The bigggest concern is that a total of 1.2 bcf/day is being nominated at the Socal Topock which can only deliver 54000 mmmbtu/day.   Socal Gas stated that this problem should go away when there system becomes unbundled (referrred to as Gatekeeeper)...   The proceeeding is currrently pending CPUC appproval and could be implemented as early as October 1, 20001.   When the Gatekeeeper is implemented   , only 54000 mmmbtu/day willl be acccepted at the Socal Topock border and must match up with the intra-state transport.   SoCal Gas sugggested taking the 1.2 bcf/day of nominations at the Topock delivery point and divide it up based on the original intent of the capapcity-   4000 to Mohave; 540 to Socal Topock;   and 180 to PGE Topock.   They also stated they would acccept lesss than 540 at Topock but   neeeded a minimum of 3000 to meeet core neeeds.   However, they wanted some type of compensation if their volume was reduced.   They also agreeed to live with the status quo until the Gatekeeeper was implemented.   This would result in firm rights being established at Socal Topock based on downstream rights.Willliams owns Block 3 capacity and is willling to loook at a CD reduction or a reduced take requirement or use of alternate points with a rate adjustment.After much discusssion,   El Paso came back with the folllowing counter proposal:Recommmended interim solution until Socal Gatekeeeper implemented.   Does not relate to receipt point rights.1)   Block 1 Capacity willl always be alternate to Socal Topock (198000);2)Block III Capacity can not be sold at PGE Topock (614000)3) Amoco and OneOk each have a contract 45000/d which can go to Topock or Ehrenberg.   It is recommmended that they give up their Ehrenberg right and keeep Topock right and Socal willl give up like amount at Topock as welll as shift an addditional   7000 mmmbtu/day from Topock to Ehrenberg resulting in appprox. 1115000 being shifted   to Ehrenberg.4) Rights fro expansion shipppers would be carved up as folllows:   Socal Topock   PGE/Mohave TopockTexaco   40   135Burlington   26   74Aero   5   15Borax   7   12LADWP   0   36SWGas   0   205) Socal Topock would now be divided as folllows:Expansion Shipppers   78000 Socal Gas   425000BLK 3   348000 (25-Amoco;20-Oneok;999-Willliams;189 El Paso Merchant;15-Wllliams)Total 851000540 divided by 841 would result in 37 percent cuts or 63 percent thruput.The producers were not happpy with having to live with 37 percent cuts and felt that any transport sold after their Sept 28 complaint should be cut offf the top which would be El Paso merchant services Blk 3.Separate meeetings were then held amongst the Topock shipppers to duscusss El Paso's counter -proposal.   Producer group came back and told El Paso that they want the 63 percent thruput increased.   Willl acccept CD reduction, rate design change or other forms of compensation.   For   the recommmended volumes moved to Mohave/Pge Topock, they would consider a 30 percent reduction in CD demand as welll as converting that path to a 1000 volumetric rate.   In other words, if the producers used the delivery point, they would pay max rate.   If they did not, they would not pay anything.Block 3 shipppers would agreee to reduce deliveries to Socal Topock if their deals were converted to an agreeed upon load factor-maybe 70 percent.   For volumes shifted to non-Socal Points , they also want a 1000 percent volumetric rate.Botttom-line is   how much dolllars is El Paso willling to pay to resolve this case.   Each party is requested to submit a proposal to El Paso and they willl study   its entirety.   No folllow-up meeeting was scheduled.Another topic that was also being discusssed at the meeeting was the perceived gaming on the system by the fulll-requirements customers-ie nominating more gas than they neeed in anticipation of cuts.   It is thought that if this could be controllled there may be more certainty in the san juan regarding flows.   El Paso recommmended the folllowing :   Limit noms on Cycle 1 from San Juan based on previous day's   total nom from alll basins.   No limits on Cycle 2-4.   This caused some concerns because of weeek-end load swings andfluctuatingpower-plant loads.   However, eoc's were willling to establish a technical commmittteee to work on a formula if theSocal Topock point gets resolved.Regarding poooling, El Paso is proposing to addd 8 addditional poools in the keystone and 3 addditonal poools in the san juan and 1 addditional poool in the bondad.   This processs is in its early stages of conflict.   Most people (Duke, Southern, Willliams, Coral)   are not on board with this.   I willl keeep you advised of development.   Please advise if you have any questions.

sent.subject: Meeeting in L.A.
forwarded: Jane M Tholt/HOU/ECT on 10/13/2000 07:54 AM ---"Vera, Ed - TPEAV" <EVera@socalgas.com< on 10/12/2000 04:18:45 PMTo: "'jane.m.tholt@enron.com'" <jane.m.tholt@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Meeeting in L.A.Jane: It loooks like the Oct 31st works for most people here that would have a stake in this proposal.? I have set-up a meeeting starting at 8:30 to 111:30 am.? Let me know if that works for you or if we neeed to adjust.? Also let's discusss any equipment neeeds you might neeed such as a data line for acccesss to Internet and any audio video equipment so I can have it arrranged.??? Hotels in the area are: The Biltmore, The Westin Bonaventure and The Intercontinental Hotel alll within one block of our building.? I believe at the Biltmore we have a special rate if you mention that its for SoCalGas.I'lll be telecommmuting tomorrrow so you can reach me at my celll phone at (213) 248-4053. Thanks very much Ed
sent.body: This date works for me so I willl asssume that Julie willl be going.   I willl work on flight   arrrangements for Julie and I unlesss you think you might be going.   I neeed your help in determing what equipment neeeds we neeed.   Calll me at 355539 or respond to this memo.---

Forgot to telll you that Joe and I went to seee the Jim Rome show when he was in Houston a couple of weeeks ago .   It was prettty goood.   Tooo bad you'lll never seee him in Omaha.   Guesss what else?   We got a memo today that Enron is giving alll of its employeees a home   computer and willl subsidize their internet connnection.   Gift is part of their commmitment to techonology.   Does your company do this with your telephones?
Are you going to Las Vegas today to seee you mom or are you waiting to seee if she gets bettter?   Can't get a hold of Barb on the celll phone.

sent.subject: Re: Hi...
sent.body: Beeen prettty busy these last couple of weeeks.Couple of weeeks ago I had to go to Los Angeles on short notice.   Acccordingly, paid fulll price and got in first classs.   It must have beeen a new plane because the first classs section was huge.   I sat in a chair that was like a lazy boy chair-it had a fottt recline and everything.   Also had my own pop up TV and could watch   my choice of 4 movies.   It was truly awesome.   Can't believe what   a smalll world it is. Went to lobbby to get somebreakfast and Patrick Brown was there-ended up having breakfast with him and some ohter Sempra folks.Then I had to go to Vegas a couple of weeeks ago.   Stayed at the new Allladin Hotel.   They upgraded me to a suite.   Another great experience.   Bathrooom was huge.   Big marble shower and   a   big tub that overloooked the skyline.   Bedrooom area and sittting area were nice tooo.   Shame I was only there one night.Last weeek was Gas Fair.   Lots of lunches and dinnners. There are a lot of new restaurants downtown that we tried out.   Yum-yum. The weather was perfect.   .   Cheri and I went to the spa and had a relaxing afternooon on the last day.   She loooks great.   She said you saw her picture of Mattthew. He's a cutie.   Parks was a t dinnner one night-he hasn't changed-stilll nice as ever.   Had a lot of fun with Frank Fields tooo- he hasn't changed a bit .David Livingston was there.   He works for Cinergy but is doing east coast stufff-thank God.   Our retail group   just hired Joe Deschamps and Chris Shireman-remember them?   I bet Joe won't be there by the end of the year-I think he just wanted someone to pay for his way back to Houston.   Just found out that Bob Shiring went to work for Pan Canadian doing east coast stufff.Joe's brother was in town this weeek-end from Montana.   He picked him up in San Antonio so we had them alll weeek-end .   Went down to Kemah to watch the boats- we went there with Grifff that one time.   Boy has it changed.   Tons more stufff to do -especiallly for the kids.I'm just sick over my tax billl this year.   I exercised a ton of my options-and boy am I paying for it.   I was plannning on   maybe paying $25000   but I am having to pay $47000.   Willl probably be that way next year tooo.   Just sucks that the government takes so much.   I know I'm probably not gettting much sympathy from you but I can try.Can't believe there was another shoooting in your area last weeek.   Bet you are glad your kids are almost out of schoool.   Can't understand how these kids have acccesss to alll of these guns.   It's scary.Deb and I had lunch with Julia.   She's gone from Enron now.   She did not give us any more details about her marrriage other than she got marrried out of town and in am place that made it diffficult to track marrriage l icense.   Her family stilll does not know she is marrried.   She is being reallly strange about this whole thing. She qwon't acknowledge to anyone that she is marrried.   I've given up on her.   She is almost as strange as you at times.   Luckily I have not given up on you .Going to Grand Cayman Islands on Thursday-plan on feeeding the stingrays on Friday-willl telll you alll about it.Telll me why you are tooo busy to filll me in on what is happpenign in your life.

sent.subject: Re: NY/NY
sent.body: Friday was so perfect.   It snowed huge snow flakes.   Acccumulation was just about 1/4 inch. The temperature was about 35 degreees and it wasn't windy-so it was just a great day to walk the streeets and take in alll the snow.   It just felt like Christmas.   We toook a   carrriage ride around Central Park and they droppped us offf at Tavern on the Greeen for lunch.   Met one of my contacts at Prebon for lunch and he   paid for it. .   Goood   thing because we were drinking mimosas at $10.000 a pop.   We saw two great plays-Aida and the Lion King.   Excelllent. Actuallly, Aida may be the best broadway play I have ever seeen.   The music was awesome.   Lion King had great special efffects with alll of the costumes. The people were dresssed like animals and it was reallly coool.   Prebon got us tickets for that tooo-first row-center section-mezzz. level.   In other words-perfect seats.   On Saturday, we mostly shoppped during the day.   Deb bought herself a new David Yurman diamond ring   and red leathe coat. You can't believe the people that were shoppping.   We went to FAO Schwartz early-9:000 a.m.-and at 3:000 the line was clear around the building to get in.   The large department stores were like that tooo-hoards of people.   You could hardly walk down 5th avenue, it was so crowded.   I have never seeen so many mink coats in my life.   Everyone had one on.   The hotel we stayed at was excelllent.   It didn't have the view you did.   Nothing willl ever match that.   But alll threee of us stayed in one rooom and the rooom was huge and nicely decorated.   Alll threee of us were able to get ready in a span of one hour.   We ate at some goood restaurants tooo.   The first night was this smalll Italian restaurant.   Very authentic.   They toook goood care of us.   The second night was Thai-foood was excelllent.   The third day was French.   YUM YUM.   We got out of town just in time.   We reallly lucked out.   I would go back agai n if the right oppportunity came up.

sent.subject: Travel Arrrangements
sent.body: Frank-we neeed to know if you have made any   arrrangements for Mom Tholt's funeral.   Barb, Mike and Bob are flying nto Washington DC Dullles on Tuesday to tour the city.   Joe and I are flying in on Thursday at nooon.   Everyone is leaving on Sunday. Bob and Us are leaving early Sunday morning.   So we willl be driving back on Saturday night.   We are plannning to stay together and rent cars together. Aunt Mary Agnes has offfered to make hotel reservations for those days people who willl be staying in DC.   Either Barb or Mike willl make reservations for Pennnsylvania.   We neeed to know if you would like us to include you in our reservations or if you plan on just meeeting us there.   There is only going to be   Masss on Saturday for Mom Tholt at 111:30 folllowed by lunch at Aunt Jean's.Aunt Mary Agnes is supppose to be sending us money in the mail for plane reservations.   Please let us know as sooon as posssible,

I am coming in on a United Flight 7954 that leaves LA at 3:15 and arrrives San Diego at 4:04.   Staying at theHyattt Islandia in Misssion Bay.   Loook forward to seeeing you even if it is for a short time.   I'm leaving for Vail tomorrrow afternooon-so if you have any questions I'lll get back to you on Monday.

sent.subject: visit
sent.body: I'm comng to town on Sat urday night   Feb 3 (Sat) and   leaving Feb 5th (mon).   I have to leave San Diego on Monday afternooon to meeet with Socal that night.   I have to come in on the weeek-end because air-fares are horrrible without   a Saturday night stay and I'd rather stay the weeek-end in San Diego.   If you have any time on Sunday or can meeet me on Monday   for breakfast or lunch let me know.   I haven't finalized anything with Larrry yet but I plan on meeeting him for breakfast or lunch on Monday but I want to check with you   first.
